Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band around rim and glazed streaky black below; exterior: trace of brown line on edge of rim and reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis (Williams 1983, 169). The number 30 (d?) is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 167, no. 100a) (Incorrectly labelled 1924,1201.743)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 723, no. 825)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1784) (phase 2)
